files.patch:
@@ -116,10 +116,0 @@ -

  • FILE

    -

    The following properties are used to configure the handler for URIs with the {@code file://} scheme:

    -
      -

    • {@systemProperty jdk.net.file.ftpfallback} (default: <false>)
      - The {@code file://} handler by default rejects any non-local file URI (as defined by RFC 8089) - as invalid. Setting this property to true enables a legacy feature where - the handler instead opens an FTP connection for such non-local URIs.

      -

      Any modern code should should use explicit {@code ftp://} URIs instead and not rely on - enabling this legacy FTP fallback feature.

      -
    @@ -182,0 +172,11 @@ + +

    File URL stream protocol handler properties

    +

    The following properties are used to configure the handler for URLs with the {@code file://} scheme:

    +
      +

    • {@systemProperty jdk.net.file.ftpfallback} (default: <false>)
      + The {@code file://} handler by default rejects any non-local file URL (as defined by RFC 8089) + as invalid. Setting this property to true enables a legacy feature where + the handler instead opens an FTP connection for such non-local URLs.

      +

      Any modern code should should use explicit {@code ftp://} URLs instead and not rely on + enabling this legacy FTP fallback feature.

      +
